item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A politician needs the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month, and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn't happen." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Muhammad Bilal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know." -- Mark Twain
